info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 10:44PM MDT until July 29 at 2:00AM MDT by NWS Billings MT
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Montana, including the following county, southwestern Yellowstone.
* WHEN...Until 200 AM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry coulees. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1042 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen based on radar estimates. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Billings, Laurel, Lockwood, Billings Heights, Shepherd, Huntley, Billings West End, Worden and Ballantine. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
